reviews.review: An incredibly intuitive and enjoyable game. It expands on everything that made the first so great, ranging from adding new game mechanics, further exploring the lore and revealing more of the story. This game is truly a masterwork that manages to merge incredibly fun, yet challenging, game play with a heartfelt tale amongst a desolate world.

A good sequel to an excellent game, although it has some problems that the first one didn´t have like that some levels are way longer that they neded to be making them a little bit annoying to get through. But that´s more of a personal opinion thatn anything; anyway the story is a 10/10 with charming characters and oh, god i love GLADoS so much

fun game to play with a friend

This game is awesome.

Both this and Portal are two outstanding games for story and lore. The entire premise of the game was fantastic when I first played it in 2011, and it continues to amaze me the thought that went into the worldbuilding. Portal's graphics seem a little dated now, and they all have that 'Valve' feel that comes from the source engine. But I think the thought that went into the character design, story, plotline, level design, and general feel of this and the last game made it something great. It's a shame they can't count to three because I'd really like a third one of these. 

10/10 would recommend this, it's really a classic on the steam store and you should definitely play it.
Графика идеальная сюжет очень классный но сначала пройдите 1 часть

just finished playing it, i'm very picky when it comes to games but this one did not disappoint. would be a brilliant game even without the story, and this way it's pure joy to play. absolutely would recommend.
when you think of the word "portal" your mind should immediately think of this masterpiece. If you thought the first game was good, you haven't seen nothing yet

Portal 2 is the perfect FPS Puzzle game.

Positives: Physics and controls feel right. Story is entertaining and fun to go through. Puzzles are difficult and fun to play through.

Negatives: None

Summary: Like other Valve games (With the HUGE exception of Artifact), this one is absolutely wonderful and a game I'll always recommend.

Other Game Recommendations: Team Fortress 2, Portal 1.
Very fun if you are litte bit smart.

Fantastic and immersive game, over the years I've always heard great things about it and for the price tag of $10 I quickly picked it up for myself and I definitely don't regret it. Everyone should play this game!

Both Portals are great mind-bending puzzle games. Portal 2 is a particular favorite due to amplifying its signature scathing sarcasm and having great multiplayer puzzles that require active teamwork and creativity.

I got this game by purchasing the 'Cake acquisition boardgame',
I'll be honest, this game is a blast! The innards of aperture science are truly shown compared to the First game.  Although some plot holes in the game make it a bit difficult to fully appreciate it at times, It's generally an all in all good investment; if you like puzzle games and relatively more story-driven games, this is a must-buy! 

8.5 / 10 "extremely re-playable!"
This game is one of my favorite games in existence. I've played it and replayed it so many times, and the fan made additions are so much fun. Definitely worth playing.

I really enjoyed Portal 2. The main thing that i dont really enjoy about it is that almost half of the achievements are co-op only. Two of which you need to have multiple friends who have not played the game before complete it with you. Overall 8/10

A masterpiece. The graphics/art style is good, gameplay is refined almost to perfection, and the story/dialouge is very well written. 10/10
It's portal again it good yes

alright, lemme give you some context for this review; 4 years ago, i got pressured by a friend into buying this game for the level creator. played with it for 2 seconds, played co-op for 2 seconds, then never touched it again. i have never been a huge fan of first-person or puzzle games. i was also spoiled on like.. most of the major plot elements from the beginning. i REALLY didn't want to buy this game, but being a horrible emotional wreck at the time, I Did Anyway!

i have owned this game for 4 YEARS, and only started (and finished) the singleplayer about a week or so ago

now keeping this all in mind, let me tell you.
this game is SO GOT DANG GOOD.... EVEN BEING SPOILED ON THE PLOT... EVEN NOT WANTING TO BUY IT AT ALL... HOLY F R I C K IS IT GOOD
the writing ALONE is a major selling point. puzzles are great. made me feel like a very accomplished idiot by missing obvious solutions but then solving it myself. 

i havent touched the co-op yet at the time of writing this, BUT i have played through the entirety of singleplayer, and it is worth buying the game just for that alone - ill probably update the review once i play through co-op

tl;dr you don't need me to tell you this, you SEE the glowing reviews on this game, 
buy this game right now do it its so GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!! YEAH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
What a great game. Nice and long with many puzzles. I love the new characters and new parts of the map. Easily the best Portal game

Requirements: 
Brain: 900 IQ
OS: Windows 7 / Vista / XP
Processor: 3.0 GHz P4, Dual Core 2.0 (or higher) or AMD64X2 (or higher)
Memory: 2 GB RAM
Graphics: Video card must be 128 MB or more and with support for Pixel Shader 2.0b (ATI Radeon X800 or higher / NVIDIA GeForce 7600 or higher / Intel HD Graphics 2000 or higher).
DirectX: Version 9.0c
Storage: 8 GB available space
Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible
